text:
It's a new enough marketplace because current drag-and-drop themes were only launched in 2020.

Payments are taken directly through the marketplace through Stripe and something else (PayPal? I forget, I use Stripe).

I think one of the reasons there are currently a lot of free ones is because HubSpot have a few theme accelerators this year focused on increasing the amount of free themes. There's one starting this month you might want to check out, the link's somewhere on the Slack. Also, a lot of agencies use free themes to drive leads for their paid services.

I've built a few marketplace themes, one paid, a few free with more free in the works. But I think there's definitely room for more paid themes and am planning on working on one later in the year.

Some don't seem to sell so well, but if my math is correct, the top selling themes have made over a million dollars... :money_with_wings:
Thank you, Stephanie for this info. I really appreciate it. I’m also thinking maybe my theme will have a free version or I’ll make another one. Haven’t researched this question yet.

Yeah, there are several out there that have free and "pro" versions of their theme with more functionality/offerings. Definitely look into the theme accelerator, you can make up to USD $10.000 per theme.
